badge_template_activities.title: AFB Talent Lab evaluates the digital products defined by the organization through design review and/or authentic usability testing by people with disabilities using a screen reader or other assistive technologies. Following testing, AFB provides the organization with a report of identified accessibility and usability issues, prioritized based on severity and matched to WCAG standards where appropriate, for the client to improve.

The organization has the opportunity to meet with AFB Talent Lab testers and accessibility experts to discuss identified issues, remediation recommendations and implementation steps, and accessibility and digital inclusion best practices. With this new knowledge, the organization implements changes to improve the accessibility and user experience for people with disabilities.

The earning organization is solely responsible for acting upon AFB’s recommendations and implementing improvements to their website, apps, or other digital products based on AFB Talent Lab’s usability testing report and suggested improvements. This badge validates the organization’s partnership with AFB Talent Lab, not the implementation of any recommendations or accessibility of any website, app, or other product.

badge_template_activities.title: Complete job shadowing requirements for a minimum of two project-based pair testing sessions, including active discussion of testing procedure during the live session; completion of a written reflection on the testing procedure and the product/environment under review; successful documentation of the accessibility and usability issues identified during the testing session.

Participate in a minimum of two Small Group Testing Sessions, facilitated by an expert Project Lead, with participants alternating between leading testing using a screen reader and serving as a supporting pair tester.

Report testing results based on Small Group Testing Sessions, including a written reflection comparing results reported by the participant to those reported by the expert Project Lead, earning a minimum score of 80% on the AFB Talent Lab Project Testing Rubric.

Complete a minimum of two Independent Practice Testing Sessions, including both independent scoping and testing of client workflows to identify accessibility and usability issues and collaboration with a pair testing partner for issue verification and quality assurance.

Report testing results based on Individual Practice Testing Sessions, including a written reflection comparing results reported by the participant to those reported by the expert Project Lead, earning a minimum score of 80% on the AFB Talent Lab Project Testing Rubric.
